intro: Newmania, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery or grayish pubescence. Newmania species typically produce small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. These plants are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
